description.plain:
Guster is an alternative rock band from Boston, Massachusetts. Often noted by the use of pleasing vocal harmonies, instrument choice (notably bongo drums), and off-beat sense of humor, Guster’s sound stretches from acoustic folk to pop-rock.
They were formed in 1991, by Adam Gardner, Ryan Miller, and Brian Rosenworcel who met during freshman orientation at Tufts University.
The group was originally named Gus and independently released their first album Parachute in 1994, while still going to college. The band had to change their name shortly after the album release due to a singer named Gus (Now Gus Black) being signed to a record label.
Throughout their career, they have worked with Barenaked Ladies, John Mayer, Rogue Wave, Ben Folds, Ben Kweller, and many others through touring and songwriting.

songs.full_title: Do You Love Me by Guster
songs.title: Do You Love Me

description.plain:
“Do You Love Me” parallels the insecurity and anxiety around the beginning of a relationship with the insecurity and anxiety that surrounds a relationship that has grown stale and complacent. Despite how different the underlying emotions are in these two states, the questions are the same: Do you feel it? Do we have it? Do you love me?!
In this case, the singer offers hopeful and encouraging words to people in either position.

songs.full_title: Barrel of a Gun by Guster
songs.title: Barrel of a Gun

description.plain:
“Barrel of a Gun” is the second track from Guster’s third album Lost and Gone Forever. It remains a staple of the band’s live shows and one of their most popular songs in their repertoire.
The band wrote the song in 1997 either during or shortly after the release of Goldfly, making it one of the earliest tracks to appear on Lost and Gone Forever. Like many other Guster songs, several different versions of “Barrel of a Gun” appeared live before the band locked down the arrangement and the lyrics. The version that the band eventually recorded came out as a single on June 28, 1999.

songs.title: Keep It Together

description.plain: “Keep It Together” is the eighth track from Guster’s 2003 album of the same name. The song tells the story of a sea battle, shipwreck, failed rescue, and the survivors founding a new colony. However, the verses telling this story are sung in reverse order.

songs.full_title: I Hope Tomorrow Is Like Today by Guster (Ft. Ben Kweller)
songs.title: I Hope Tomorrow Is Like Today
songs.title_with_featured: I Hope Tomorrow Is Like Today (Ft. Ben Kweller)

description.plain:
IHTILT is a song to a romantic partner on the night that the relationship has made an emotional or physical breakthrough. The singer is awake, reveling in the moment, while the partner sleeps. The singer is afraid that everything just gained will be lost the next day (hence the title and refrain). It might have all been erased the second his lover fell asleep, so he’s hanging on to the day because he knows it’s special, and anxiously hoping that everything they felt and had today will still be there tomorrow.
The song played in the 2005 comedy Wedding Crashers, as Owen Wilson and Rachel McAdams'  characters each crept through the hallways of the Cleary’s home in their pajamas to visit the other, both anxious about the romantic connection they’d made earlier in the day.

songs.title: Parachute

description.plain:
“Parachute” is the eleventh and final track on Guster’s debut album of the same name. It is slower than most of the other songs on the record, although it shares a similar rhythm to “Mona Lisa”. It is also one of two tracks on the record to feature Steve Garrett on cello, with “Dissolve” being the other.
“Parachute” has seen some of the most live appearances out of the songs on the album; the band played the song throughout the early and middle 2000s, and brought it out for a few performances in every year since.

songs.title: Happier

description.plain: “Happier” is the eighth track from Guster’s third album Lost and Gone Forever. It was first performed, with some lyrical differences, on April 23, 1998 in Somerville, Massachusetts. It remains a live staple in the band’s set lists, and is one of the most-performed songs in their catalogue.

songs.full_title: Two Points for Honesty by Guster
songs.title: Two Points for Honesty

description.plain:
“Two Points For Honesty” is the tenth track from Guster’s third album Lost and Gone Forever. It is a live favorite, although out of the songs from the album, it is one of the least performed.
The song has inspired some of the band’s most well-known merchandise, including a T-shirt with a scoreboard showing – literally – two points for honesty.
Guster first played “Two Points For Honesty” live on October 1, 1999; it is one of the few tracks from Lost and Gone Forever that the band did not perform before the album’s release.

songs.title: Airport Song

description.plain:
“Airport Song” is the fourth track off of Guster’s second album Goldfly. It remains a staple of their live show; only “Demons” from the same album tops it in live appearances.
The band first performed the song at a January 1997 show at Villanova University, with Ryan Miller announcing that the band had never played the song, not even in rehearsals. However, the band had recorded Goldfly in December 1996, so this may have been a white lie.
At live shows, a tradition is to throw ping-pong balls at the stage at the end of “Airport Song”. This is because during the fade out of the album version, listeners can hear the sounds of a ping-pong game happening in the foreground.

songs.full_title: Jesus on the Radio by Guster
songs.title: Jesus on the Radio

description.plain:
“Jesus on the Radio” is the seventh track from Guster’s fourth album Keep It Together. It is often played unplugged live, with members of the band heading far upstage and playing right up in the audience’s face. Also, in recent years, it has acted as either the main set’s or the encore’s closer.
Before it had a real name, the track used to be called “Joe Song”, as Joe Pisapia co-wrote it with Ryan Miller. Pisapia also plays banjo on the track.

songs.title: Fa Fa

description.plain:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Sfkm7hd7zlo
“Fa Fa” is the fourth track from Guster’s third album Lost and Gone Forever. It was first performed in June 1998.
According to a painstaking project listing every video played on MTV’s 120 Minutes, the music video for “Fa Fa” – Guster’s first official video – aired on May 7, 2000. Although the band had performed at Woodstock 1999 months earlier, the video boosted Guster’s fame further into the mainstream, allowing them to book more shows around the country.
This song features the flute and saxophone chops of Karl Denson, as well as Adam on trumpet and Brian on the trombone.

songs.title: Demons

description.plain:
“Demons” is the second track on Guster’s second album Goldfly. It is the song the band has performed most from the album, as well as out of all of the songs in their repertoire.
The track was first performed in July 1996 at the (now closed) Lion’s Den in Manhattan; the band had finished writing it that morning. However, the song went through further changes before the band recorded it; early live bootlegs of the song show significant differences in lyrics. The song also changed keys from its original arrangement to its recorded version.

songs.title: Either Way

description.plain: “Either Way” is the third track from Guster’s third album Lost and Gone Forever. The song was first performed, with slight lyrical differences, in August 1998. Although it’s one of the least performed songs from the album, it’s still among Guster’s most-played songs in their catalogue.

songs.title: Long Night

description.plain:
This track was originally called “Anthem” when only the melody of the song was finished. The name “Long Night” was created when frontman Ryan Miller came up with the lyrics, one day before the band recorded the song.
Brian describes it as a ‘stoner track’, for all band members had just used marijuana when they recorded the take that made it to the album. He said he couldn’t get the drums in the first one or two takes, so they decided to smoke weed and the fact they did might explain some of the psychedelic vibe of “Long Night”.

songs.title: I Spy

description.plain:
“I Spy” is the fifth track from Guster’s third album Lost and Gone Forever. Along with many other tracks from the album, the band first performed “I Spy” on June 24, 1999 at Lafayette Square in Buffalo, New York.
Ryan has mentioned that “I Spy” was the last song written for the record; they rushed it to tape and never wrote an official end to the song that satisfied them. For a while, the band played a verse from “Numbers” by G. Love & Special Sauce to end the song live. They have also played an additional original verse live, which they wrote to act as an ending to the song.

songs.title: Center of Attention

description.plain:
“Center of Attention” is the sixth track from Guster’s third album Lost and Gone Forever.  It was first performed live, along with some other songs from the album, at Lafayette Square in Buffalo, New York on June 24, 1999.
In its early stages, the song was called “Rio” due to its musical similarity to the Duran Duran song of the same name.

songs.title: Diane

description.plain:
“Diane” is the first track from Guster’s fourth album Keep It Together. It is not one of the most-performed songs from the record, but it is a live favorite nonetheless.
The song features versatile instrumentation which sets the tone for the rest of the album; Adam plays piano, Brian steps out from the drums to play guitar, and guest performers Ryan Leago and Jim Hoke play clarinet.

description.plain:
“All the Way Up to Heaven” is the seventh track from Guster’s third album Lost and Gone Forever. It is not performed live often; however, as it was first performed in January 1998, it is one of the older songs to appear on the album.
Ryan used the “Samba” drum beat on an old Casio keyboard to compose the song; the beat appears on the recorded version, as well as in some live performances where the band will link the keyboard up to the venue’s sound system. The song is also one of the only tracks to feature the theremin, thanks to the contributions of Phish’s very own Page McConnell.

songs.lyrics:
[title]All the Way Up to Heaven
[verse]
He said to only look up
He said to never look down
Down is where we came from
He said to hope for the best
And take a load off my chest
Soon I could be happy
[chorus]
And go all the way
Up to heaven
And go all the way
Back home
[verse]
He thought I might need his help
No one gets high on themselves
I just seem so lonely
He is just trying to be nice
And spread around his advice
I could be that happy
[chorus]
And go all the way
Up to heaven
And go all the way
Back home
[bridge]
Stay the way I am today is certainement disaster
He can tell a fairy tale
It's happily ever after
Just relax and greener grass
Will grow here for a change
Maybe then we'll last a million years
Or more or more or more or more
(More, more, more, more)
[chorus]
And go all the way
Up to heaven
And go all the way
Back home
[verse]
Yes, I do believe what he says
I want to be happy
I could sure use his help
No one gets by on themselves
He can make me happy
[outro]
And I will only look up
(It's a warm summer breeze)
And I will never look down
(It's a weakness in your knees)
It's a perfect place above full of everlasting love
(Down is where we came from)
And I will hope for the best
(Nothing to fear, nothing to hide)
And take a load off my chest
(You just say what's on your mind)
Needn't think before you speak, this is how it's meant to be
(He could make me happy)
And I needed his help
(Ever high, never fall)
Now I am high by myself
(You can do no wrong at all)
In this heaven up above filled with everlasting love
(I am never lonely)
And I will try to be nice
(To the light)
Because you only live twice
You could be this happy
To the light
(Yes, do you believe what he says?
[?] could [?] happy)

description.plain: “Rainy Day” is the eleventh and final track from Guster’s third album Lost and Gone Forever. It is one of the least-performed tracks by the band, and one of the the few from Lost and Gone Forever that the band did not play before the album’s release. Guster first performed “Rainy Day” on April 19, 2000.

songs.lyrics:
[title]Kid Dreams
[verse]
So there I was, fifteen, stuck in
High school was no prom king
Zoned out in a daydream of a
Pretty girl, my own beauty queen
[bridge]
I was too shy to talk
I was round and soft
All the kids would drawl:

Then I’d start to shrink
Became too hard to see
They got what they need
I got the beady eyes
[chorus]
You can get what you want
Make a plea to the dark
Not as hard as it seems, kid dreams
[verse]
What did I want
What did I need
I got three squares a day
I got a bed for sleep
I couldn’t shake a deep belief in a
Pretty girl who would save me
And then sure enough
They would call my bluff
They’d jab and trip me up
Hit right between the eyes, boy
Fill my cuts with salt
Slowly I’d dissolve
That was all they saw
The boy with the beady eyes
[chorus]
You can get what you want
Make a plea to the dark
Not as hard as it seems, kid dreams
[bridge]
Oh God now here she comes
My perfect lady luck
I never did give up
I never did give up
The once and future king
The best that’s ever been
If only they could see

Been a link in a chain

songs.title: So Long

description.plain:
“So Long” is the ninth track from Guster’s third album Lost and Gone Forever. It is a relatively obscure track from the band, although it has seen some revitalization in live shows.
The song was first performed, with slight lyrical differences, on April 23, 1998 in Somerville, Massachusetts.

[verse]

[chorus]
So long, so long and on to the next one
Go on , and it won't be too soon

[bridge]

But in my defense, I'd do it again

[chorus]

Go on and it won't be too soon

But in my defense, I'd do it again
I don't need to know who you are
[chorus]
So long, so long, front foot leads the back one
Go on 'cause it won't be too soon
You're lost and gone and on to the next one
I don't need to know who you are
[Outro]
Don't need to know who you are

songs.title: Mona Lisa

description.plain:
“Mona Lisa” is the second track from Guster’s debut LP Parachute. Like many songs on the record, “Mona Lisa” came from some of Guster’s earliest songwriting efforts, and was played at some of the band’s earliest shows.
Out of all of the tracks on Parachute, “Mona Lisa” has been played at the most shows throughout Guster’s career. Along with Ryan Miller’s and Adam Gardner’s usual vocal harmonies, the song’s notable for Michael Rivard’s contributions on the upright bass.

The first live performance of “Rocketship” appeared in January 1997 at Villanova University, along with several other tracks that would appear on Goldfly such as “Airport Song”, “Great Escape”, and “Getting Even”.

songs.title: Backyard

description.plain:
“Backyard” is the fourth track from Guster’s fourth album Keep It Together. It features a number of guest musicians on its recorded version, and despite its complexity, it has seen recent daylight live.
The band gave its guest musicians a one-take rule, meaning that they could only record one take of their part for the song. Also, guest musicians were not allowed to listen to the song or have any knowledge regarding chord progressions.
“Backyard” – originally called “Boneyard” – is a song about parental abandonment, with the encroaching weeds and dying roots serving as both symbol and metaphor of the effects on the family that is left behind.

songs.lyrics:
[title]Well
[verse]
Late afternoon when the sun was unraveling
Walking the trail to the end of the gravel
And into the well went a lucky old silver coin
Tumbling down, in the dark I was fading
And leaning so far and so quietly waiting
A wish that was made at the bottom of the well
[verse]
What happened then is so hard to recall
But as quick as the snap of a whip I was falling
And tumbling, following after my silver coin
Silence as day turned into the night
Could I go back, how I wish that I might
I was the boy in the bottom of the well
[verse]
My parents were weeping and frantically searching
"He'd always been wandering looking for something
One moment he's here and the next he is surely gone."
"But he didn't return for a day and night
We all knew that something just couldn't be right
A voice on the phone said he'd fallen in the well"
[verse]
I woke from my sleep with the firemen screaming
And lowering down all the things I was needing
A basket, a bible, a blanket, and a bell
And dozens of voices yelling in unison
Loudly and echo-y, hazy and boom-y
"Hold on, hold on, hold on, hold on, hold on"
[verse]
I'd always been dreaming of places and scenes
Fireflies only light that you see
The rhythm of crickets and toads the only sound
And soon I'll be leaving but now I'm believing
In wishes and wells and a way to get back
To the sacred place I've stumbled on and found
[verse]
Late afternoon while the sun was unraveling
Walking the trail to the end of the gravel
And into the well went a lucky old silver coin
Tumbling down, in the dark I was fading
Leaning so far and so quietly waiting
A wish that was made at the bottom of the well

songs.title: Melanie

description.plain:
“Melanie” is the eleventh and final track from Guster’s second album Goldfly. It’s seen fewer live performances than other songs on the album.
The song is a hidden track on Goldfly, although it was one of the earliest written songs to appear on the album. The band first performed “Melanie” in January 1996 at the University of New Hampshire.
The changing placement of “Melanie” on different versions of Goldfly marks the value of the album. On the independently released version of Goldfly, the track appears first before “Great Escape”, although it remains unlisted. On the Hybrid label version, it appears in its intended position as the last track. On the “bad CD pressing” version, which was only given to members of the band’s rep program, “Melanie” appears as the first track while “Bury Me” and “Getting Even” appear combined as a single track.
Because Goldfly is now out of print, versions with “Melanie” as the first track are now valuable among collectors, while the “bad CD pressing” versions hold even more value.

songs.title: Endlessly

description.plain:
On the audio commentary track for “Endlessly”, Guster members show different thoughts on where the chorus and the verse sections of the song are. While Adam says the ‘come on, love’ part is the chorus, Ryan thinks it is the verse.
Guster mocked the possibility of the song becoming a hit or a single but eventually, it did. “Endlessly” is the third single from Evermotion and the only music video the band members shot for the album.

songs.title: Great Escape

description.plain:
“Great Escape” is the first track from Guster’s second album Goldfly. The band first performed the track at the (now closed) Lion’s Den in Manhattan in July 1996, a day after they had written it.
The track marks a slight change in Guster’s style. In their earlier recordings, the band stuck with two guitars and Brian Rosenworcel’s bongos, with the occasional addition of a full drum kit, the upright bass, or the cello. On Goldfly, the band began to include more instruments, such as the xylophone featured on “Great Escape”. Speaking of “Great Escape”, the track features Guster beginning to experiment with other styles of music, which shows in the flamenco-tinged guitar solo during the breakdown.
On the independently-released and “bad pressing” versions of Goldfly, the hidden track “Melanie” appears before “Great Escape”.

songs.title: Perfect

description.plain:
“Perfect” is the third track from Guster’s second album Goldfly. Like most of the deeper cuts on the album, the song has not seen a live performance since the early 2000s.
The song now known as “Perfect” came to life as “Needle”, and was first played in its recorded form in October 1996. The original version was first played in February of that year, and has almost no similarity to its successor. You can listen to the original version of “Perfect” here.

songs.title: Window

description.plain:
“Window” is the fourth song on Guster’s debut album Parachute. It is one of the most performed songs from the album; like many other tracks on Parachute, it comes from some of the band’s earliest songwriting efforts and live shows.
In 1995, a Northwestern Universty student named Renny Maslow produced a music video for “Window”; the band considered this clip under “lock and key” until showing it to an audience at The Riviera Theater in Chicago on March 29, 2003:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CEz0TgTyv8s
Despite Guster’s vast amount of archived material available online, this clip seems to be the earliest film content of the band. Note the mid-Nineties aesthetic of it, as well as the hairstyles of the band members.

songs.title: G Major

description.plain:
“G Major” is a political protest song written at a time when the US was entering costly wars under arguably false pretenses.
The song is about the fear and jingoism used to manufacture consent for those efforts. But as the chorus says,  the singer “can see what’s really going on.”

songs.title: Happy Frappy

description.plain:
“Happy Frappy” is the tenth song from Guster’s debut LP Parachute. It is one of the band’s earliest songs, appearing on set lists from their earliest shows.
The song peaked in live popularity during the Goldfly and Lost and Gone Forever eras, and has shown up at scattered gigs in the years since. The band has noted that the song is hard to play; this might owe to the song’s relative obscurity live, despite its popularity with fans.
Adam Gardner features as the primary vocalist on this track, as he does on “Fall In Two”.

songs.title: Timothy Leary

description.plain: Timothy Leary is the 4th track on Guster’s 2007 “Satellite: EP”.  The song refers to Timothy Leary, a writer and psychologist who was prominent figure of the counter-culture movement in the 1960s.  He advocated the use of LSD for therapeutic and mind expanding purposes.

songs.embed_content: Read “Timothy Leary” by Guster on Genius

songs.lyrics:
[title]Timothy Leary
[verse]
I closed the door and stepped into the city
The city stepped right back to me
There's cracks on every sidewalk of this city

One single voice makes a deafening sound
You can be anything this time around
[verse]

I wrestled down an old King Kong
I rescued maidens captive on that island
Hero in a uniform
[pre-chorus]
My conscience was clean and taking control

And dusty old crates, and my father's tapes
But Timothy Leary said the words which led the way
[chorus]
One single voice makes a deafening sound
You can be anything this time around

songs.title: Love for Me

description.plain:
“Love For Me” is the third track on Guster’s debut album Parachute. As a deeper cut from the record, it hasn’t seen much play live; among the tracks on Parachute, it ranks as one of the least-played songs. During the Goldfly era, “Love For Me” saw its peak in live performance; appearances of it in live shows then waned. It made one appearance in 2012 and two in 2013; one of those performances was during the band’s playthrough of Parachute in commemoration of the album’s 20th anniversary.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BuI6ITlRuwk
The intro of “Love For Me” and the breakdown of *Goldfly"Airport Song" share a similar rhythm; however, “Love For Me”’s intro follows a I-iii-VII refrain, while “Airport Song”’s breakdown has a I-Vb-IV progression.

songs.title: Grin

description.plain:
“Grin” is the seventh track from Guster’s second album Goldfly. It remains a relatively obscure cut from the record, seeing few live performances since the Lost and Gone Forever era.
The band first performed “Grin” in January 1996, making it one of the earliest tracks later recorded for Goldfly. This original and longer version had a few different lyrics, although the arrangement remained mostly the same for the recording.

songs.title: I’m Through

description.plain: This song is an early version of what would become “C'mon” on Ganging Up on the Sun. While both are about running away from one’s current situation, “I’m Through” focuses more on the despair that led to the decision to leave, while “C'mon” is more about the hope represented by the destination.

songs.title: Getting Even

description.plain:
“Getting Even” is the eighth track from Guster’s second album Goldfly. It remains a relatively obscure cut from the record, seeing only scattered performances live since its release.
The band played this song for the first time as a show closer at Villanova University in January 1997. The original version of this song, performed at that gig, ran for over seven minutes long.
On the “bad pressing” version of Goldfly, “Getting Even” and “Bury Me” appeared as one track. This version of the album was only distributed to members of Guster’s rep program.

songs.title: Bury Me

description.plain:
“Bury Me” is the ninth track from Guster’s second album Goldfly. It’s seen more play live than most tracks from the album.
First performed in 1995, two years before Goldfly’s release, the song remains one of the earliest holdovers later recorded for the album. At a https://archive.org/details/guster1995-11-15.flac16/guster1995-11-15t04.flac at Gunnerz in Iowa in November 1995, Ryan Miller jokingly called the song “Mosh-Pit Sacrifice: Death! Death! Death!”
On the “bad pressing” version of Goldfly, “Getting Even” and “Bury Me” appeared as one track. This version of the album was only distributed to members of Guster’s rep program.

annotatable.link_title: You Saw A Light by Guster

songs.lyrics:
[title]You Saw A Light
Fan: Is this all filming?
Ryan Miller: No
Fan: 'Cause the truth would have come out if it was filmed. The real Guster
Miller: That's true
Fan: They don't give a rat's ass about their fans. Son of a bitches!
I mean, let me tell ya...
(laughter)
Fan: The most ungrateful human beings in the world. In the world. It's true, I bust my ass...
Miller: You think so?
Fan: ...and never heard the word thank you. I bust my ass day and night for this band. You know when you played that show at the park in Providence? And you sat down at the table, and you signed all those fucking autographs, and you signed the girl's thigh and you signed her breast, but do you know who was happy? I was. 'Cause you deserve something like that. You busted your ass when no one gave a shit about you when you were playing the Tin Angel, or the fucking Cubby Bear, or the Music Factory, or the Side Door in St. Louis. Jesus Christ! No one gave a shit
Fan: This is my 44th show
Miller: 44th?
Fan: 44. I mean, the most miserable show I've ever seen was the Michigan Theatre. I've never seen more three [sic] obnoxious people in my life. All sick, treating me like shit, and I almost walked off the job. Almost left the show. Do you know I tell people I work for this band?
Miller: Yeah, I'm... I'm sure that you do
Fan: I know that drives Brian crazy. It's great though, I mean, yeah, I work for a rock 'n' roll band with this guy Ryan Miller, the times, I mean, now that I tell people I work for a rock 'n' roll band 'what a fucking job!'
Miller: (laughs) It's a job
Adam Gardner: (laughs)
Fan: I deserve something; I get no credit from the three of them
Someone in background: The man is (inaudible)!
Fan: I had to run this show... admit it, Miller, who fucking packed up the van? You didn't even lift a goddamn thing. What ever happened in that hotel room? That was after the Lupo's show. To get the job, I know for a fact she had to sleep with the four of you. Am I right? What will be the future of this band? What do you think the odds are?
Miller: I don't know
Fan: What do you mean you don't know? Well, what do you think, Miller? What would you deserve? What do you think is fitting? If you were in my shoes, if you wore these size 12's...
Miller: I don't know. I'm on the fence with you
Fan: You're on the fence?
Miller: Yeah
Fan: What do I have to do for you to get off the fence? I'm not that des... I'm not desperate at all
Fan: How many shows have I gone to where you just don't feel like playing? It's amazing! You play the same goddamn songs night after night. You got... you don't take any requests. I mean, if this band would listen to me... You've gotta get into the hippie scene. You figure, open for Ratdog and Rusted Root... Bobby Weir would have come out and played with us... We are going on a huge headlining tour in the fall. I mean, we're gonna play the Orpheum, the State Theatre, the Vic Theatre in Chicago, the Ogden in Cleveland, the Roxy in Atlanta... I mean, where are all these fans coming from? Instead, we could open for Rusted Root, play in front of 5,000 a night, and then go on the big tour. That's what we should do, Miller
Miller: So, take requests, play different songs, play with Pat McGee, that's the formulas [sic] for success?
Fan: You're damn right. I was the man in my high school, let me tell ya... I could drop dead of a heart attack and you wouldn't give a shit
Miller: I'm not sure that's... that's entirely true
Fan: Would you come to my funeral?
Miller: Yeah, of course I would
Fan: Would you pay your condolence call?
Miller: Ah, yeah...
Fan: Would you sit shiva for me?
Fan: The Push Stars? The thing about them is, they paved the way for bands like you. Am I right?
Fan: You hanging out tomorrow night? Do you wanna have a beer? Or are you gonna hang out on your bus? Are you gonna ditch me or what are you gonna do now? I can't get over the nerve when you said "you're not sleeping over at our house!" I never get an invite to sleep over the house. (You were gonna throw me out on the street) And the one time I sleep over the house... for God's sakes, it was like pulling teeth! (God forbid, you should do anything for me.) I get shit from you, and "no, you can't sleep in the house!" (Where do you get off saying that?) "No, you cannot see me at the house." (Would you ever share a hotel room with me?) I have never been offered to sleep in the house! (What about that futon in your room?)
Miller: This is where it all comes out... here it all comes out
Fan: I am there when nobody's playing in front of you. I have worked hard for this band. I am the kind of person that when the band gets big (then the big shots come), I get left out. I get fucked over. They don't give a shit, they don't appreciate the work I do for this band
Miller: So you think it's all a ruse? You think the love for the fans is all a ruse?
Fan: I think it's all a fraud
Fan: Parachute is slower than ever. Fucking Rocketship... you wanna... you wanna take a knife and kill yourself! The band sucks! You know what I was thinking of, is when I first saw this band, I'll tell you... about a year and a half ago, these guys would come out and just fucking play... tear it up... and fucking play. Come out, I mean, they would come out with fire! Now, it's like we're dead to the world. I mean... maybe a Met Café show every once in a while, that's great. I mean, just, it was incredible, now it's, 'how can we get off the stage as fast as possible?' I'm in here, 'we need to cut this song, cut that song' instead of just (clap hands) fucking play, you know, Miller? No setlist, just go out there and run with it... whatever happened to "Rain", the Jackopierce cover song? They used to do "Like A Prayer" by Madonna, it was incredible. You can't even look me in the fucking eyes! Look at me! Look me in the eyes! You're scared shitless, you're hiding behind a fucking camera, pretending to tape me. Whatever comes out of these lips is the truth, you're not gonna have it on tape. You know, I mean, it's an act, Miller, that's what I'm talking about
Fan: You've been honest. Rosenworcel - totally different fucking story. You can't believe a goddamn word that kid says! Am I right? When we were at the Met game, and Rosenworcel, I first see him, he comes out, and he's got these slacks with these tank tops and he's got all this hair coming out, and he goes 'I've just come from the gay parade.'
Miller: (laughter)
Fan: I mean, I thought the fucking kid was gay! And I still think he's gay. I mean, he had all this hair and ew, he had the Mets cap sideways, I mean I thought the kid got a fucking blow job from a guy!
Miller: That would be bad?
Fan: I'm not against gays. I believe in integration. But I tell ya something, if it wasn't for him, you and him wouldn't have a goddamn roof over your heads, I'll tell you that much
Miller: The franchise
Fan: "The franchise" is right! Did ya hear that?
Miller: He's the heart and soul of this band, huh?
Fan: I mean he is, if it wasn't for him, I mean, this shit wouldn't go on! And if it wasn't for me, I mean I... I am a vital part to this band going on
Fan: Gardner was like the biggest cheeseball of all time, the cheesiest kid at Pingry
Gardner: (laughter)
Fan: Did you ever see the movie Hoop Dreams? I mean, you got all these, you know, fans and people, and they're all sitting here and they're all, 'don't forget about me' when you're playing Jones Beach headlining, when you're going to the Garden and you're going here to the Meadowlands, you know blah blah blah the Fleet Center, they're all going 'don't forget about me' at the end of that fucking movie, Hoop Dreams, okay, and the same thing for you, Miller. And the goddamn difference between me and the fucking radio, the fucking radio people, the fucking record company...
Brian Rosenworcel: Hey! Watch your mouth over there!
Fan: The goddamn difference about me is that when this band doesn't fucking make it, or doesn't fucking go anywhere, you get dropped by the label, I'll still be here, Miller. I'll be holding your hand. And that's the difference between me and those other people. 'Cause the radio people won't give a shit, the record company people won't give a shit, when you can't get a fucking gig and you lose the record, I'll still be here
Miller: But why?
Fan: I'll be here 'cause I give a goddamn cent about this band
Miller: Why? But you just said how awful we are
Fan: 'Cause I care
Miller: Why?
Fan: Because, like I said, I'm crazy, and you're just as crazy for getting in this fucking business. You saw... YOU SAW A LIGHT... you saw something that inspired you with the three of you that 'we might just give this thing a shot.' And as crazy as you were to think of getting into this fucking business, I'm as crazy to follow this goddamn band, but the same light you saw, that say [sic] 'hey, maybe we can make a living at this, maybe this can be fun,' is the same fucking light I saw when I see this band up there. The same light you saw that this could be fun and interesting is the same light that I saw when I first saw this fucking band. That's why
Fan: You can blow me off, like you always fucking do. But you know, when you're standing up there, fucking basking in all your glory, and I'm nowhere to be found, you remember I was there and I gave a shit more than anyone. I'll tell you this - when they talk about Michael Jordan, and they talk about his ambition to win and how nobody's more competitive than him... and you remember this, Miller, outside of the three of you, and I don't give a shit who works with you, who gets you on the fucking radio, I want this band to be more successful than anyone. And you can take that to the fucking bank
Miller: Do you feel better?
Fan: I'm feeling all right
Miller: You just have to promise right here, on tape, that you're not gonna kill us. OK, just make that promise. This is going to Hard Copy... this is going right to Hard Copy
Fan: I have busted my ass...
Miller: Are you gonna kill us, yes or no? Look me in the eye
Fan: When was the last time you got laid? You tell me and then I'll tell you whether I'm gonna kill you or not. I mean I have said all I said... I've worked...
Miller: Seven... six...
Fan: ...so hard for this band...
Miller: Five... four... three... two... one
Fan: God.. goodbye, God bless Guster
Fan: You know, you gotta make your mark somewhere. You know, you gotta stake, you know plant the cabbage somewhere...
Miller: Plant the cabbage?
(laughter)

songs.title: Emily Ivory

description.plain: ‘'Emily Ivory" was originally written and recorded for Guster’s 2006 classic “Ganging Up On The Sun” with high hopes to release as a main single. But for mysterious reasons, the band decided to leave the song off the album and locked it away – never to see the light of day until the album’s 15th Anniversary in 2021 with the expanded edition of the album.

songs.title: Cocoon

description.plain:
“Cocoon” is the ninth track on Guster’s debut album Parachute. It is one of the earliest songs from the band, having shown up on their 1993 demo EP and at several live performances in the band’s early years.
The song showcases the band’s experimentation with unusual percussion; aside from Brian Rosenworcel’s masterful bongo playing, the song also features the use of a zipper as an instrument, notably in the beginning.
Despite the early popularity of this song, the band did not perform it much after the year 2000, much like they did with many songs on Parachute.

body.plain:
“Cocoon” is the ninth track on Guster’s debut album Parachute. It is one of the earliest songs from the band, having shown up on their 1993 demo EP and at several live performances in the band’s early years.
The song showcases the band’s experimentation with unusual percussion; aside from Brian Rosenworcel’s masterful bongo playing, the song also features the use of a zipper as an instrument, notably in the beginning.
Despite the early popularity of this song, the band did not perform it much after the year 2000, much like they did with many songs on Parachute.

songs.lyrics:
[title]Airport Song
[verse]
Glad you made it, welcome to the farm
Who's your daddy? I'm your daddy now
I'm here seeking only what I need
In your mind is where I'll plant my seed
It's for sure
[chorus]
Oh, let me keep you in this place
You'll be better off this way
I will keep you warm and safe
You'll be better off this way
Learn to love the price you pay
So trust me dear you're better off this way
[verse]
Put to bed the sun and sister moon
I'll be hiding in your dirty room
I'll go there seeking only what I need
La ti da we'll stay there 'til we bleed
It's for sure
[chorus]
Oh let me keep you in this place
You'll be better off this way
I will keep you warm and safe
You'll be better off this way
We'll not wake you from your sleep
Leave you wandering counting sheep
No more sad and sunshine days
Trust me dear, you're better off this way
'Cause you'll be selling books at the airport

songs.lyrics:
[title]Amsterdam, Maine
[verse]
I threw away your greatest hits
You left them here the day you split
Your bass guitar and Shaggs CD
Well, they don't mean that much to me
Right now I'm going through your things
These days I'm changing all my strings
[chorus]
Gonna write you a letter
I'm gonna write you a book
I want to see your reaction
I want to see how it looks
From way upon your cloud
Where you've been hiding out
Are you getting somewhere
Or did you get lost in Amsterdam
[verse]
You won't get too far from me
Believing everything you read
You're wasted in the great unknown
And I am finally ready to dispose
From all your vintage clothes
Your drugs and every secret code
[chorus]
Gonna write you a letter
I'm gonna write you a book
I want to see your reaction
I want to see how it looks
From way upon your cloud
Where you've been hiding out
Are you getting somewhere
Or did you get lost in Amsterdam
[verse]
From your red balloon
You were a super hi-tech jet fighter
Floating over planet earth
Come back down here
I'll show you where it hurts
Take this bitter pill
Is it easy to swallow
[chorus]
Gonna write you a letter
I'm gonna write you a book
I want to see your reaction
I want to see how it looks
From way upon your cloud
You're never coming down
Well are you getting somewhere
Or did you get lost in Amsterdam
Amsterdam

songs.lyrics:
[title]Barrel of a Gun
[verse]
I know a movie star, I've got her plastered to my wall
Just like we're dear old friends, like she already knows me
She's perfect as she seems, lifts me right out the mezzanine
'Cause I finally fell in love, I've been waiting forever
[chorus]
4, 3, 2, 1
Went out the barrel of a gun
Keep my head way down
Stay out or stay in
Half dead, half numb
She's enough to make me warm
It's all so safe and sound
[verse]
Eyes back and fast asleep, if you could see what I could see
Drip drop a lovely dream
God damn you movie stars, can't you just play a minute more
'Cause we'd be the best of friends, I've been waiting forever
[chorus]
4, 3, 2, 1
Went out the barrel of a gun
Keep my head way down
Stay out or stay in
Half dead, half numb
She's enough to make me warm
It's all so safe and sound
[bridge]
She will be sweet on me, just like a mystery
It's not so hard to see, if I'm not mistaken
She comes from far away (far away)
And gets closer every day (every day)
And all that i can say (I can say)
She's all I want and all that I live for
[chorus]
4, 3, 2, 1
Went out the barrel of a gun
Keep my head way down
Stay out or stay in
Half dead, half numb
She's enough to make me warm
It's all so safe and sound
[End: Miller]
Thank you. We're gonna be inviting... we're gonna be inviting a bunch of our friends up tonight to play music and help put in some of the instrumentation. This is Donnie and Amy and they're gonna play strings, say hello everyone

Either way

Happens every time, so it must be true

Happens every time, so it must be true

Down, down
Down, down

songs.lyrics:
[title]Come Downstairs and Say Hello
[Acappella Intro]
[verse]
Dorothy moves
To click her ruby shoes
Right in tune
With Dark Side of the Moon
Someone, someone could tell me
Where I belong
Be calm, be brave
It'll be okay
[verse]
No more messing around
And living underground
Or New Year's resolutions
By this time next year I won't be here
I turn on, turn on MTV
The volume's down
Lips move, they say
It'll be okay
[hook]
I'm telling the truth, I've said it before
Tomorrow I start in a new direction
One last time these words from me
I'm never saying them again
And I shut the light and listen as the watch unwinds
[verse]
Telling the truth I've said it before
Tomorrow I start in a new direction
One last time these words from me
I'm never saying them again
I look straight at what's coming ahead
And soon it's gonna change in a new direction
Every night as I'm falling asleep
Those words repeated in my head
[chorus]
Voices calling from a yellow road
To come downstairs and say hello
Don't be shy, just say hello
[verse]
To tell you the truth, I've said it before
Tomorrow I start in a new direction
I know I've been half asleep, I'm dreaming
(I'm never doing that again)
I look straight at what's coming ahead
And soon it's gonna change in a new direction
Every night as I'm falling asleep
Those words repeated in my head
[End: Miller]
Woohoo, thanks guys, thank you

songs.lyrics:

[verse]
Ramona, where have you been?
I couldn't go to sleep 'til you came in
Ramona, you're Miss Oklahoma
And you miss Oklahoma
I'll get you what you want
[chorus]
'Cause there were days when a refrain
Would brighten our corner of Hickory Lane
When you would sing that song for me
Just like your favorite singer
[verse]
And why'd you have to be so nice?
A wink and a girly smile

That was something
But did you want me to stay?
[bridge]
When I was younger and thought of myself
I never dreamed I'd become like this
A snap of your fingers, an end to the argument
Anything for you, love
[outro]
'Cause there were days when a refrain
Would brighten our corner of Hickory Lane

songs.lyrics:
[title]Amsterdam
[verse]
I threw away your greatest hits
You left them here the day you split
Your bass guitar and Shaggs CD
Well, they don't mean that much to me
Right now I'm going through your things
These days I'm changing all my strings
[chorus]
Gonna write you a letter
I'm gonna write you a book
I want to see your reaction
I want to see how it looks
From way upon your cloud
Where you've been hiding out
Are you getting somewhere
Or did you get lost in Amsterdam
[verse]
You won't get too far from me
Believing everything you read
You're wasted in the great unknown
And I am finally ready to dispose
Of all your vintage clothes
Your drugs and every secret code
[chorus]
Gonna write you a letter
I'm gonna write you a book
I want to see your reaction
I want to see how it looks
From way upon your cloud
Where you've been hiding out
Are you getting somewhere
Or did you get lost in Amsterdam
[verse]
From your red balloon
You were a super hi-tech jet fighter
Floating over planet Earth
Come back down here
I'll show you where it hurts
Take this bitter pill
Is it easy to swallow
[chorus]
Gonna write you a letter
I'm gonna write you a book
I want to see your reaction
I want to see how it looks
From way upon your cloud
You're never coming down
Are you getting somewhere
Or did you get lost in Amsterdam
Amsterdam
[End: Miller]
We wanna thank our friend Ben Kweller for coming out, uh, and playing tonight. We're seeing him a little later and I... I was sort of, you know, the whole idea of doing a... a concert around an album, you know, still being an active band that still makes records and writes songs, you wanna be careful not to continually trade in nostalgia but I also, as a fan of music, if one of my favorite bands were to play one of my favorite records in its entirety, I've been there, I've done it and it's magical and so it means a lot that you guys are here to celebrate this with us and we know that we've been a part of your lives and yeah, cheers to you, weirdo dude. Cheers to all of you, thank you very much, it means an awful lot to us, seriously

songs.lyrics:
[title]This Is How It Feels to Have a Broken Heart (Mitchell Spinach Remix)
It was the darkest day
I could tell from the moment you spoke my name
Said in a miserable way with every year you've come to regret it
We've colored in the lines and followed all the signs
Fought a war till the war was over
Said you'd never be the kind with an ordinary life
Now this how it feels to have a broken heart
Look at the mess we made
Now we stopped and say what we always say
And then you make the great escape
With every year you'll come to regret it
We've colored in the lines and followed all the signs
Fought a war till the war was over
Said you'd never be the kind with an ordinary life
Now this how it feels to have a broken heart
And everything we had you think that it's a trap
You fought a war now war was over
You knew what you would find was an ordinary life
Now this how it feels to have a broken heart

songs.lyrics:
[title]I Spy
[verse]
We went down at the Gay parade
Mumbled words under my breath
There is something I've been meaning to do
I've been dying to tell you
I've been so damn tired
[verse]
We went down at the Gay parade
Bitter words under my breath
There is something I've been meaning to do
I've been dying to tell you
I've been so damn sad
Cause I spy something red
[chorus]
You don't know how far you've gone
Or recognize who you've become
Where'd you grow to be so hard?
Sick of playing my part
[verse]

Alcohol under my breath
There is something I've been meaning to do
I've been dying to tell you

songs.title: Happier
songs.embed_content: Read “Happier” by Guster on Genius

album.full_title: Lost and Gone Forever: Live by Guster
album.name: Lost and Gone Forever: Live

songs.lyrics:
[title]Happier
[verse]
Say goodbye, lose your friends
Make them go, don't need them around
'Cause it's time, lose your friends
Make them go was never supposed to be like this
They were too weak
Too prone to break
Their needs too deep
Their skin too thin
By now you took what is to take
Tear it apart and start again
[chorus]
Go on
If this will make you happier
It got you this far
Do what you have to
[verse]
You've wasted every moment
Of your Saturdays and your Sundays
You're wasted from the boredom
It was never supposed to be like that
Like your father said
"Just do what was done unto you, always"
In your father's steps
You'll do what was done unto you
It won't be hard to start again
[chorus]
Go on
If this will make you happier
It got you this far
Do what you have to
[Post-Chorus: Miller/Gardner]
And you're gone now
(But you've known this would come and you've left me alone)
And did it make you happier?
(And you're lost and you're gone, don't take it so seriously)
It wasn't that hard
(Go on, get going, I'm fine on my own)
Do what you have to
(It got me this far, finally got it figured out)
[bridge]
One more inch
You son of a bitch
You've been wasting my time, always
And now you're half awake
You bend 'til you break
And make the same mistakes, always
[chorus]
So go on
If this'll make you happier
It got you this far
Do what you have to
[Post-Chorus: Miller/Gardner]
And you're gone now
(But you've known this would come and you've left me alone)
And did it make you happier?
(And you're lost and you're gone, don't take it so seriously)
It wasn't that hard
(Go on, get going, I'm fine on my own)
Did what you had to
(It got me this far, finally got it figured out)

songs.title: Amsterdam (Acoustic)
songs.embed_content: Read “Amsterdam (Acoustic)” by Guster on Genius

album.full_title: Love Guster Don't Eat Them: EP by Guster
album.name: Love Guster Don’t Eat Them: EP

songs.lyrics:
[title]Amsterdam (Acoustic)
[verse]
I threw away your greatest hits
You left them here the day you split
Your bass guitar and Shaggs CD
Well, they don't mean that much to me
Right now I'm going through your things
These days I'm changing all my strings
[chorus]
Gonna write you a letter
I'm gonna write you a book
I want to see your reaction
I want to see how it looks
From way upon your cloud
Where you've been hiding out
Are you getting somewhere
Or did you get lost in Amsterdam
[verse]
You won't get too far from me
Believing everything you read
You're wasted in the great unknown
And I am finally ready to dispose
Of all your vintage clothes
Your drugs and every secret code
[chorus]
Gonna write you a letter
I'm gonna write you a book
I want to see your reaction
I want to see how it looks
From way upon your cloud
Where you've been hiding out
Are you getting somewhere
Or did you get lost in Amsterdam
[verse]
From your red balloon
You were a super hi-tech jet fighter
Floating over planet Earth
Come back down here
I'll show you where it hurts
Take this bitter pill
Is it easy to swallow
[chorus]
Gonna write you a letter
I'm gonna write you a book
I want to see your reaction
I want to see how it looks
From way upon your cloud
You're never coming down
Are you getting somewhere
Or did you get lost in Amsterdam
Amsterdam

songs.lyrics:
[title]Homecoming King
[verse]
On your way to the best years of your life
Everyone's banging on their gongs
The sooner you leave, the sooner you're home
[pre-chorus]
Back in Massachusetts
To your golden age
Where they tuck you in at night
[chorus]
You didn't see it coming
Now who you gonna wave to?
'Cause this time you're not homecoming king
[verse]
Did you hear that?
Have you heard that sound before?
Do you even know where it is coming from?
It's getting too loud
It keeps on pushing you out
Into the arms of 1994
[chorus]
You didn't see it coming
Now who you gonna wave to?
'Cause this time you're not homecoming king
You're not homecoming king
[bridge]
You stand on your own
Wasn't what you hoped at all
Do you still recall it
You're giving dead-arms in the hall
Stay right where you are
You'll be half of who you were
When you would always win
So count the days 'til you give in
[pre-chorus]
Back to Massachusetts
To your golden age
Where your crown is shining bright
[chorus]
You didn't see it coming
Now who you gonna wave to?
'Cause this time you're not homecoming king
[chorus]
You didn't see it coming
Now who you gonna wave to?
'Cause this time you're not homecoming king

songs.title: Empire State (Live Acoustic)
songs.embed_content: Read “Empire State (Live Acoustic)” by Guster on Genius
songs.lyrics:
[title]Empire State (Live Acoustic)
[verse]
Been the crawl of a mountain
Been a link in a chain
I've been scolded for stealing
Been told to behave
I've been reading the forecast
Something's coming this way
But it's taking forever
I'm too tired to maintain that
I'm slow
[verse]
I've been a scratch on the surface
I've been a clog in the drain
I've been melodramatic
I've been sleeping for days
I've been one in a million
Been a million to one
This is taking forever
Always seems to return that
I'm slow
[chorus]
All hands up, salute the Empire State
Faith be true, you know the way
Ten miles tall in this: an empty space
Fallen walls all around
Destroyed again
Destroyed again
[verse]
I've been digging to China
I've been a fish in the sea
I've been talking to Jesus
But he's not talking to me
I've been reading the forecast
Something's coming this way
But it's taking forever
It always seems to return that
I'm slow
[chorus]
All hands up, salute the Empire State
Faith is true, she knows the way
Ten feet tall in this: an empty space
Fallen walls all around
We'll build again
Rebuild again
[outro]
I've been the crawl of a mountain
I've been a link in a chain
Been scolded for stealing
I've been carted away

songs.title: Keep It Together
songs.embed_content: Read “Keep It Together” by Guster on Genius

album.full_title: Keep It Together: Live from the Beacon Theatre by Guster
album.name: Keep It Together: Live from the Beacon Theatre

songs.lyrics:
[title]Keep It Together
[Instrumental Intro]
[verse]
When we all had finally washed ashore
It was clear there was no one else around
We declared a national holiday
A chance to build it from the ground, ground
[pre-chorus]
So far away from everyone
And everything starts today
[chorus]
Let's keep it together
Can we keep it together?
We're singing a new song now
And everything starts today
[verse]
Can we rise? Can we get along alright?
Can we miss the storm that sucks the whole world in?
And the boats went out at night
And the choppers in the sky
They searched but they could find no trace of us
[pre-chorus]
So far away from everyone
And everything starts today
[chorus]
Let's keep it together
Can we keep it together?
We're singing a new song now
And everything starts today
[bridge]
The thunder struck, the clouds appeared
I feel this crew was not prepared
And pretty soon the boats came for us half a million strong
We gathered arms and fired shells
We built a wall around ourselves
And pretty soon the spirit was a lot like what it used to be back home
[pre-chorus]
So far away from everyone
And everything starts today
[chorus]
Let's keep it together
Can we keep it together?
We're singing a new song now
And everything starts today
[chorus]
Let's keep it together
Can we keep it together?
We're singing a new song now
And everything starts today
[End: Miller]
Mister Joseph Pisapia, from Nashville, Tennessee

Hanging on a wall of stars

[verse]
Where'd you get that
Blue ocean in your head
I know you're there when you close your eyes
Don't waste my time
Just make up your mind

It's the hardest thing there is to do
Just treading water here with you
On a Sunday afternoon
Sunday afternoon

Where'd you find that
Fence your sitting on?
You know I'll climb it if you want me to
So don't waste my time
Just make up your mind
[chorus]
It's the hardest thing there is to do
To stand beneath you feeling blue

songs.title: Ramona
songs.embed_content: Read “Ramona” by Guster on Genius

album.full_title: Keep It Together: Live from the Beacon Theatre by Guster
album.name: Keep It Together: Live from the Beacon Theatre

songs.lyrics:
[title]Ramona
[verse]
Ramona, where have you been?
I couldn't go to sleep 'til you came in
Ramona, you're Miss Oklahoma
And you miss Oklahoma
I'll get you what you want
[chorus]
'Cause there were days when a refrain
Would brighten our corner of Hickory Lane
When you would sing that song for me
Just like your favorite singer
[verse]
And why'd you have to be so nice?
A wink and a girly smile
And why'd you have to punch my eye?
That was something
But did you want me to stay?
[bridge]
When I was younger and thought of myself
I never dreamed I'd become like this
A snap of your fingers, an end to the argument
Anything for you, love
[outro]
'Cause there were days when a refrain
Would brighten our corner of Hickory Lane
When you would sing that song for me
The only one you know
But I know now, not from the start
We're going to pieces; we're falling apart
So come and sing that song for me
Just like your favorite singer

songs.lyrics:
[title]Scars & Stitches
[verse]
Can you remember what the future held?
A little candy ring and a mystic ocean's shell
But they were anesthetized and slowly washed away
Left all the poison in the sands in which I played
[chorus]
I don't mind falling down and scraping up my knees
Scars and stitches always fade and only strengthen me
With my eyes as wide as pearls my only centerpiece
Is taken like the dead man's urn and tossed into the sea
[verse]
Write me a letter
But dot your I's
And cross your T's
Nothing was everything to me
Under the monster's claws and in between his teeth
Was the shadow and a silhouette of what I'd thought I'd be
[chorus]
I don't mind falling down and scraping up my knees
Scars and stitches always fade and only strengthen me
With my eyes as wide as pearls my only centerpiece
Is taken like the dead man's urn and tossed into the sea
And it's floating on the ocean, floating oh into the sea

I'm not scared

I will build a wall
Sensing trouble from a mile away

I'm not scared

Try

songs.title: So Long
songs.embed_content: Read “So Long” by Guster on Genius

album.full_title: Lost and Gone Forever: Live by Guster
album.name: Lost and Gone Forever: Live

songs.lyrics:
[title]So Long
[verse]
First I heard all that you had to say
That's when it all fell apart
Might be hated, but I can't pretend
I liked you better before
[chorus]
So long, so long, front foot leads that back one
Go on, and it won't be too soon
I'm gone, I'm gone and on to the next one
So long, and I won't be back soon
[verse]
Yes I'm blue but from holding my breath
Like I have from the start
I'm the villain and I should confess
I liked you better before
[chorus]
So long, so long, front foot leads that back one
Go on , and it won't be too soon
I'm gone, I'm gone, bet you saw this one coming
So long, and I won't be back soon
[bridge]
It's hateful to say I see it this way
Don't even know who you are
In my defense, I'd do it again
I don't need to know who you are
[chorus]
So long, so long, front foot leads that back one
Go on and it won't be too soon
I'm gone, I'm gone and on to the next one
Go on, cause I won't be back soon
[bridge]
It's hateful to say I see it this way
Don't even know who you are
In my defense, I'd do it again
I don't need to know who you are
[chorus]
So long, so long, front foot leads the back one
Go on and it won't be too soon
I'm lost and gone and on to the next one
I don't need to know who you are
[outro]
I don't need to know who you are
[End: Miller]
Just wanna take a second, it's always sort of emotional when we come back to Boston and play the place where we started. I mean, it's crazy. When we all met each other we were skinnier, we had more hair and it was 1991 and I don't think any of us had any idea we would still be able to play music and we would still be able to do things and invite musicians and sell out shows and have people care about our band.
It means so much to us if this album means something to you, if you feel ten percent about Lost and Gone Forever the way I do about a bunch of albums, it's the most humbling experience you could ever have, so thank you so much for supporting our band.

songs.lyrics:
[title]All the Way up to Heaven
[intro]
Alright, here we go!
[verse]
He said to only look up
He said to never look down
Down is where we came from
He said to hope for the best
And take a load off my chest
Soon I could be happy
[chorus]
Go all the way
Up to heaven
And go all the way
Back home
[verse]
He thought I might need his help
No one gets high on themselves
I just seem so lonely
He is just trying to be nice
And spread around his advice
I could be that happy
[chorus]
Go all the way
Up to heaven
And go all the way
Back home
[Break: Rosenworcel]
1, 2, 3, 4
[bridge]
Stay the way I am today is certainement disaster
He can tell a fairy tale
It's happily ever after
Just relax and greener grass
Will grow here for a change
Maybe then we'll last a million years
Or more or more or more or more
(More, more, more, more)
[chorus]
All the way
Up to heaven
And go all the way
Back home
[verse]
Yes, I do believe what he says
I want to be happy
And I could sure use his help
No one gets by on themselves
He can make me happy
[outro]
And I will only look up
(It's a long silent breeze)
And I will never look down
(It's a weakness in your knees)
It's a perfect place above full of everlasting love
(Down is where we came from)
And I will hope for the best
(Nothing to fear, nothing to hide)
No one gets by on themselves
(You just say what's on your mind)
Needn't think before you speak, this is how it's meant to be
(I could be that happy)
Ever high, never fall
You can do no wrong at all
In this heaven up above filled with everlasting love
To the light
To the light
To the light
[End: Miller]
Amazing!

songs.lyrics:

[verse]

Did you hear that?
Have you heard that sound before?
Do you even know where it is coming from?

It keeps on pushing you out
Back to the arms of 1994
[chorus]
You didn't see it coming
Now who you gonna wave to?
'Cause this time you're not homecoming king
You're not homecoming king
[bridge]
You stand on your own
Wasn't what you hoped at all
Do you still recall it
You're giving dead-arms in the hall
Stay right where you are
You'll be half of who you were
When you would always win
So count the days 'til you give in
[pre-chorus]
Back to Massachusetts
To your golden age
Where your crown is shining bright
[chorus]
You didn't see it coming
Now who you gonna wave to?
'Cause this time you're not homecoming king
[chorus]
You didn't see it coming
(No you did not)
But who you gonna wave to?
'Cause this time you're not homecoming king
[outro]

songs.lyrics:
[title]Eden
[verse]
All I want is the world
And everything for me
You can rattle off your talk
All that matters is what I see
[pre-chorus]
If you break me down (break me down)
Selfish desire (break me down)
Is all you'll blame
'Cause desperate times (desperate times)
Call for desperate measures
And I am not ashamed
[chorus]
Oh it took me a long
Time to come to this
I have chosen that path
I am (I am)
I am me (I am only for me)
[verse]
All my dreams are so closed
If I open them to you
You can count them all as lies
You can believe me
Or you can believe the truth
[pre-chorus]
And if you break me down (break me down)
Selfish desire
Is all you'll blame
'Cause desperate times (desperate times)
Call for desperate measures
And I am not ashamed
[chorus]
Oh it took me a long
Time to come to this
I have chosen that path
I am (I am)
I am me (I am only for me)
[hook]
But I could let you in
Put your feelings on the shelf
There's only room 'cause it helps myself
Oh I could let you in
But it's to no avail
I only listen 'cause it helps myself
[chorus]
Oh it took me a long
Time to come to this
I have chosen that path
I am (I am)
I am me (I am only for me)
[bridge]
I took a cane from a blind man
I tasted the fruit in the Garden of Eden
When I walk out of here
I know I'll stand clear
But the taste in my mouth still remains
Still remains
[outro]
Oh it took me a long time to come to this
Oh it took me a long time
I am only for me

songs.lyrics:
[title]Happy Frappy
[verse]
Not much of this makes sense to me
The river leaves run cold and dry
But it keeps me from swinging from tree to tree
And sometimes I'm too scared to even try
Hashing through the possibilities
They seem as endless as the sky
You seek the truth in the quiet breeze
But the air is too thin to reply
[chorus]
Well I know that's where I'll never be
Cause I can see the summer's done
I try to let the river flow in and out of me
And pray I float the way I think I want
And pray I float at all
[verse]
Distant notions of subtle residue
Cling to minds from our past
Tell us what is what and who made who
But time's events move us too fast
Simple sentiments whisked away by anxious steel wool
Struggling to content ourselves with what we think best
That what makes us happy of which we seem never full
Is actually more than plenty for it is already possessed
[chorus]
Well I know that's where I'll never be
Cause I can see the summer's done
I try to let the river flow in and out of me
And pray I float the way I think I want
And pray I float at all
[verse]
Not much of this makes sense to me
The river leaves run cold and dry
But it keeps me from swinging from tree to tree
And sometimes I'm too scared to even try
Ultra confusion feigns clarity
Scattered delusion excuses destiny
It's never exactly how it appears to be
It's too much for any of us to even try
Try to see
[chorus]
Well I know that's where I'll never be
Cause I can see the summer's done
I try to let the river flow in and out of me
And pray I float the way I think I want
And pray I float at all

songs.lyrics:
[title]Cocoon
[intro]
Bongo Brian!
[verse]
Just one more time he said
As he falls down to his own
I'm doing fine he said
As the tears fall down alone
Why must you question me?
Do you want your future blown?
Look at the sight of him
What can he do to show you?
[pre-chorus]
Living life for others
Shuffle through the day
Everyone is out to get him
What do they have to say?
Pull yourself up out of this rut
Make it all come clean
'Cause the day the sun gets in your eyes
Is the day that you'll be free?
[chorus]
Open the door
(The world is too young)
To see what you've felt before
When all the sleeps end restlessly
Without, without time
[bridge]
Dream yourself to sleep at night
(Dream yourself to sleep at night)
Only lying beneath the clouds
(Only lying beneath the clouds)
Spend your lifetime in the shade
(Spend your lifetime in the shade)
When the early morning sun wakes up
To reveal the pain you've laid
[chorus]
Open the door
(The world is too young)
To see what you've felt before
When all the sleeps end restlessly
Without, without time
[End: Miller]
I think that's my favorite part of the whole set, when it goes to [?] through the chamberlin. Thanks Josh!
Aright, it's "Happy Frappy" time, stoners!
